reviews.review_title: Death has never been as blunt and honest
reviews.content: The first half of the movie, I previously thought, was superficial. Skye and Calvin had so much dynamics together yet it could have been executed in a way that viewers could find it more profound. While Maisie Williams had an amazing performance, Asa Butterfield's acting fluctuates throughout the movie.However, the second half shows why it deserves a 10 stars for me. In theatre, this type of illness-death story has been told plenty of times, creating a good number of conventions and cliche for the genre. This movie gives you something completely different. It depicts a beautiful and wonderful platonic friendship that people have rarely seen even though we desperately need one (despite the fact that deep down inside, we still ship them because of the chemistry they had together). In addition, it deals with cancer and death in the most brutal yet very blunt and honest way, which hits you really hard at your emotion.I love the direction it chose to take. It's cute and vibrant and filled with energy, even till the last minute of the movie, despite how tough the problem they were dealing with.Personally, as a person around their age who is also working on figuring out myself, I relate to them considerably and feel inspired significantly by this movie. It's an important one. One that I would love to recommend to everyone.

The grumpy old man says, after seing this again and again. if your in a low mode and doesnt want to cry, then do not watch, because its a heartwarming and gutwrenching drama about cancer in old teenagers/young adulthood , with the bucketlist like wishes and hopes, warmth and friendship, tears and fears . if you have cancer,know someone with cancer or just want to feel the weight of cancer on your shoulders, the you should watch ''then came you''.the filmography and story are brilliant and gripping, edited and mixed with musical elements that goes hand in hand with the caracters and mood of the story. it has a wonderful warmth in the settings, and it has a very cuddling atmosphere allround.the acting are just amazing, on the first view i had embedded myself so into the drama that i was sure that the actress playing skye was really going to die in the real world. i seldomly go that into the characters, so give it a try yourself. i had a similar experience when viewing the film ''life as a house'',so this is really good stuff.what may seem like a drawback is the length of the movie , if so do be staminous, it will grip you in the end . this is a buulseye drama and are highly recommended by the old grumpy man.

This was not my type of movie but somehow I went to see it. I was very happy that I saw it. Yes, there were laughter and tears and I'm male. All cast did a great job in making the movie feel alive. It's definitely worth seeing

A comedy about cancer, it's always delicate to make a movie like that, especially since almost everybody had to deal with cancer at one point in his life, maybe not personally but we all know somebody dear to us that died or suffered from cancer. But since the show The Big C it's proven that it can work. At first the character of Skye played by Maisie Williams annoyed me a bit but the more I grew with the movie the more you could understand her point of view, trying to make the best out of the little time she still had in her life. First I thought they didn't show enough of the nasty stuff that comes with cancer but in the end it wasn't a bad move as it's supposed to be a romantic comedy, a sad one nonetheless. I had some laughs and tears, just what I expected from a movie like this one, as it brought up some memories from lost friends that died of cancer. Then Came You surprised me, especially since I didn't expected much of it.

It's a good movie definitely worth seeing. It has an interesting take on terminal illness and I think it has a nice balance between comedy and drama. I especially loved the jokes that make you wonder if it's ok to laugh at them. The performances of the two leading actors Asa Butterfield and Maisie Williams were also very very good.

Not many movies have launched an emotional grappling hook into me, but this one did! It had me smiling for the first 3/4 of the movie, then eating ice cream with tears in it for the last 1/4 of it! I don't tear up easily, but I'm glad to see a movie out there with some substance to it nowadays!
For a while... this movie made forget arya stark, just skye

reviews.review_title: Asa Butterfield shines. An emotional ride.
reviews.content: I recently decided to watch this after having seen Asa Butterfield's role in "Sex Education" on Netflix and thinking he was an amazing actor. His work in this film is no different.The story lacks substance in some parts, but throughout the movie, you grow attached to the relationship between Butterfield (Calvin) and Maisie Williams (Skye.) The story is cheesy in parts and at times Williams put me off, but there's no denying Butterfield's depth of character in that he conveys emotion so well, albeit awkwardly at times and makes the viewer fond of him.The film contains some great heart-warming moments, some which we can all identify with while still providing the occasional laugh.

Death is inevitable, but it's not frightening if you really lived.
Work like you don't need the money, love like you've never been hurt, and dance like no one is watching." --- Satchel Paige

This is a classic story about terminally ill teenager with a cliched bucket list. Although there is nothing novel to the plot, the cast is on point, music is refreshing and the filming locations are beautiful. Watching this won't be a life changing experience, but it won't be a waste of your time either.

This was a very simple movie that didn't try to do to much but did it right.
It makes you realize how precious life is and how lucky we all are to be alive.
A simple story about a boy and girl who changed each others lives forever.The acting was great, and the story had ups and when it was over questions still lingered in my head and the viewer pretty much had to figure out some stuff when the closing credits started.7.2
A film deeper than it seems at first, I liked it a lot

So funny, so emotional, amazing acting.
Maisie Williams' future is to be one of the greatest actresses, at least that's what I believe.

This movie is beautifully shot. Most feel good movies are slow, they slowly creep into your emotions but this one is fast, thr emotions hit you right on your face.
The direction was awesome..but i think the screenplay should have been better.
The cast is perfect..the acting looked natut.
The story is the star of the show. Only a talented director can make this story on screen and deliver the right emotions.
Overall its a very good movie

Enjoyed it.
Great Story.
Good Cast.
Well made.If your reading this to decide if you should watch this or not.
Go watch it.

Oh my god this movie was so good
💔💔What a nice story
It had the perfect mix of comedy, drama, and romance. This movie had me laughing and crying. Asa Butterfield is my favorite young actor. He always perfects any role he plays.

This is a film about a girl having a chronic illness rom-com film that we've seen on the fault in our stars. The premise is the same if you've watched that film and i recommend you doing so, But this is a more lighthearted film than tfios. Acting is the definite positive in this film, Cast is good Asa and Maisie williams made this movie a good movie. It's one exhilarating film and i know that love this type of genre will definitely like this one.

Mainly watched because of Asa Butterfield, the kid continues to amaze! Really nice trip for anyone who has or had a serious illness such as cancer. A realistic look on how to live and not let the illness cheat us out of living our life. What a nice journey that's believable and gives us some of the real emotions involved. All involved make this a solid flick, great ensemble!

Rich in emotions, full of meaning and beautiful human values
thank you !
FILM TO SEE
Really love the store line and the characters in the movie. The story is very deep and really hit you in the emotions. Amazing work with the characters 👌.

reviews.review_title: Unbearbly saccharine, even my Maisie William fan teen daughter couldn't stand it.
reviews.content:
I was on a business trip up to Kingston with my 14-year-old daughter in tow. The WFF promotors were giving out same tickets to this at the airport and since we did not need to where we were going til the next day we decided to grab a hotel in Woodstock and catch a few WFF flicks that night.
The other reviewer (who is obviously associated with promotion of the film since it is their only activity on IMDB) says the audience went form crying to laughing. That is an outright lie. The only sound heard was groaning. including from my daughter who is from the prime target demographic.
Seriously, even 14 year old girls are aware they are being spoon fed saccharine junk if you pile on enough clichés and worn out tropes.And 23 "ten" votes ere out of 32 votes? Really? That's shilly.
This film has,a little bit of everything. Comedy, romance, sadness and love. Great movie about sharing and giving.

reviews.review_title: Not typically my type of movie.
reviews.content: That being said this is an absolutely splendid movie. A great cast top to bottom. I read another review on here stating Asa Butterfield shines in this role, well that's a bit of an understatement. He was PHENOMENAL. Maisie Williams was sheer PERFECTION. I'm not sure if she could have been any better. She's going to be a theatrical force to be reckoned with for years to come. And as if they were enough, you get Ken Jeong, Titus Burgess, David Koechner and Tyler Hoechlin. Just a great ensemble cast and a story with a ton of heart and emotion.
This movie is so touching. One of the best movies ever. Maisie Williams is an amazing character and Asa Butterfield as well. I enjoyed every minute of the movie
I'm personally tired of how many movies are lacking depth and substance. This movie has that and is very entertaining. 3 thumbs up!

I honestly had no high expectations for this one but, I'm glad I watched it. It seems like a teenage movie but I'm sure it could appeal to an older audience.
The attempts at comedy were on point, though it was based on a girl nearing the end of her life it didn't feel soppy at all. Maisie Williams did an excellent job.

I haven't enjoyed watching a movie for a long time. This one is so touching and emotional and worth watching every second. I I was sad, impressed, happy, laughing of tears, crying of sadness. It touched my soul from every aspect. Don't miss out on this.

Think of the movies "A walk to remember" with Mandy Moore and "The Bucket List" with Morgan Freeman. Put them both together and you get this movie. The acting is brilliant, characters are very likable and funny. The story is sad but adds comedy into it. Recommend the movie. The swearing is mostly in the first half of the movie, it's like they decided to stop it in the second half. I am usually a hard critic, however I loved this story.

Asa just makes this movie, even though he is the second lead or co-lead! He is adorable! When one can reach great acting that young, with a face look or small motions, bravo! As my title says I cried quite few times, The second half of movie exceeds the first; However all through story one emotes. As I like to say in many a review, This is not a new subject plot wise, with teens as cast. I would put this a little above middle. 7/10

This movie is so underrated. Critics doesn't know the essence of this relatable story. It's all about friends, love, and death. I'm didn't regret watching this movie even wasting money on this. Cast is also great. They are famous but I felt like I just knew them from this movie. Asa, Nina, and Masie got their job done so well.
Beautiful movie with emotions and human values.movie to watch out.

With so many fun, intense, realistic emotions with great acting of the actors...
you may have tears in your eyes... 😊
I cried like 3 times in this movie. Both Asa and Maisie portrayed their characters amazingly with such emotion and talent. Loved it!

Sure. This story is being told again and again. A teenager with cancer living the last days of her live with a boy that taking care of her, like A Walk To Remember, Now Is Good, The Faults In Our Stars. This one is no exception, the unlikely meeting, the contrast, the argument, then evolving into a beautiful friendship, or love story. Maise does a great job.7 for the standard production. One more for the honest, warm writing.

reviews.review_title: Deep movie with a true meaning
reviews.content: Then came you is a deep and touching movie that I really enjoyed. There should be more films like that one.

reviews.review_title: Worth the watch - Maisie and Asa shine
reviews.content: I wanted to see this movie because of Maisie Williams. Similar stories have been done in movies several times in recent years. "Then Came You" doesn't make it to the level of "Me and Earl and the Dying Girl", but it's still worth the watch. In "Me and Earl and the Dying Girl", I found the characters much more unique and realistic. Maisie's and Asa's performances did carry the film though. I wished they would have delved more into the way Maisie's character felt abandoned by her friends. I liked the way they started out with the scene with her three girl friends ignoring her. They were having a hard time dealing with the fact that she was dying. But later on, they seemed to get over it, and we never really saw how that happened. We saw Maisie drinking heavily at a party. I thought it may interfere with her meds and she may have a seizure. Instead she just threw up out in the street with Asa and seemed to genuinely have a good time at the party. I think they had some missed opportunities to make the characters more unique and real. But I still thought both Asa and Maisie did a great job with the script they were given. I did think the flight attendant seemed a bit old for Asa. She said there was 3 years difference, but it looked almost like a teacher and student type of thing.I do think this was a good performance for Maisie. It was worth the watch. But, it makes me want to watch "Me and Earl and the Dying Girl" again. I have watched it twice already. It's really the best in this genre. I loved seeing Maisie though!!

It can be one of the most faviurite 2018 moves that I've watched. Good filming location and sweet musics made the movie sound better. The story was told repeatedly, for instance "The fault of our stars" or "the perks of being wallflower" have the same story.
However, I had a different feeling about this movie. To be honest after I watched the aforementioned movies, I became depressed while after watching this one I felt relief.
That's an amazing concept of showing a true friendship. I love this movie and it made me cry.

I put this movie off but finally wahtched it. I came here to see Maisie Williams and she does not disappoint. While a sad story it was also a happy one. I believe that this movie offers each person who sees it something unique that they may take away from it.Furthermore, as a Game Of Thrones fan I've seen this girl grow up on screen over almost an entire decade as Arya Stark and now her breaking out roles. She has come along way from that little girl warrior we saw in the GOT Pilot..The plot, the writing, character development, etcetera. They all receive a cumulative 10/10 from me.Regards,
DynamicDannyl
I was deeply moved by the story. Anyone who has lost someone to cancer will relate to the people in this film.
I went into this movie not knowing what to think. This is a must watch. Tear jerker for sure. I found this just looking randomly on Netflix, HIGHLY RECOMMEND

What a wonderful experience and amazing acting. This almost never happens that you feel like you are inside the movie and observing the people first hand and actually witnessing the feelings of all the characters. An absolutely beautiful storyline; uplifting, motivational and just magical with a message of happiness and achieving inner fulfillment even in a downright ordinary life. I recommend this movie! Loved it!

reviews.review_title: A little different YAF terminal illness romance
reviews.content: A little different from the usual YAF movies. Asa Butterfield plays a morose hypochondriac who is healthy but attends a cancer support group. He meets a British girl who is sick and helps her with her bucket list. Wish the actress had been more appealing. She's quite funny as she plays the cancer card.It avoids the cutesy things some YAF movies suffer from. Nina Dobrev is in a supporting role as a flight attendant and object of his affection.OK for one watch.
I literally bawled my eyes out😢. It had a lot of funny scenes but Sad moments.

What an inspiring movie, with great moments of bravery from the characters. It is a story of friendship and courage. Despite the tears there were some hysterical moments especially with the bucket list!! Recommend it highly!

WOW! indeed ...you can't make a teenage movie and then impress old guys unless you're truly good at what you're doing!when the movie started, i thought it's just a fun max-5*** 'kids' movie ... but as it moved on it got better and BETTER and in the end i was wondering what did i just watch!? and well, the young characters here aren't teenagers really and they're young adults after all ...as an overall depressed person, it's really quite a positive experience to hear or read or see a movie with a sad story but feel happy and hopeful in the end while still remembering this was 'just another story' and no more than that ...very well made, no flaws i could detect at least, and well worth the time spent watching ... it's only a little more than 90 minutes in time length but you feel like you've been watching a much longer movie without feeling bored at all ... and that's another positive criteria i usually 'judge' movies with ...

This is definitely a great movie. Sure, there were some cute/cheesy moments. Overall, I thought it was a wonderful movie and worth watching. Great cast. They all played their parts beautifully. My favorite character was the flight attendant played by Titus. He was extremely funny.

reviews.review_title: I'm not sure where all these 10* reviews are coming from but it's likely not for this movie
reviews.content: I can see how some people may enjoy this movie a little bit but all the WOW 10*'s is a bit fishy, and you could tell within the first few minutes that this is not a 10* anything.The chemistry between the characters Maude and Asa is just off, I honestly think a lot of this movie is supposed to annoy you. I was not a fan of how the majority of the characters played off each other.It may be for you so give it a shot but it just rubbed me the wrong way, and obviously I was a big fan of hers in the 'ol dragon show. Oh well, hopefully she can pick something else up.

It's okay. There are some really sweet moments and the premise has potential. However, I didn't enjoy Maisie Williams' performance. For me the humour felt exaggerated and forced. Asa is great as always but the American accent is distracting. Nina Dobrev also seemed out of place as a love interest.

reviews.review_title: A Drama Mixed with Love Story and Real-Life Harsh Moments
reviews.content: This is the story of a girl who is dying because of cancer from the lens of a boy. They meet in the support group. The girl has a to-do list before she dies. They boy helps her to fulfill the tasks in the list. The story is about harsh moments of real-time life. There is a romantic theme behind the story which is making the story more appealing.

Maisie Williams and Asa Butterfield do fantastic jobs portraying their characters in a believable and sympathetic manner. Their great demonstration of a heartbreaking story makes for a wholesome, heartfelt movie which definitely requires a box of tissues. Absolutely loved this movie and the story!

Everyone has a bucket list of some kind. A terminal illness adds urgency in fulfilling what is on that bucket list. Sometimes it can't be done without help from very special friends and family. "Then Came You" is about a teenager named Skye, played by Maisie Williams, who is dealing with a terminal illness. Along comes, Calvin played by Asa Butterfield who thinks he has just about every illness that is out there. The two meet at a cancer support group.A contributing factor to Calvin's hypochondria was the death of his twin sister several years before in an auto accident that also left their mother in a severely depressed state. To help deal with his phobia Calvin attends the cancer support group. Then comes Skye, a Spitfire free-spirited young lady that makes an instant connection with the very studious no-nonsense Calvin. Although the connection seems to be one-way at first, Skye pushed on to gain Calvin's friendship by going to his work at the local airport where Calvin works as a baggage handler. Her daily visits then begin to rub off on him and soon Calvin gains his confidence back and loses his hypochondria along the way as he helps Skye fulfill her bucket list.The movie is a great example of what true friendship is. No doubt it is a tearjerker and Maisie Williams is amazing as Skye and carry's the movie all the way to her conclusion. Asa's performance, however, came across as bored. There were a few scenes where Asa looked as if he was somewhere else. His piercing blue eyes rolled a few times whenever Maisie delivered her lines. There was some chemistry between the two actors, but not enough to care what happens to Calvin and his love interest Izzy a stewardess played by Nina Dobrev. Her performance was also flat and one dimensional. I found it hard to believe that Izzy would fall for a guy that looked almost ten years younger than she was. One last thing, who's idea was it for Calvin to show Skye the coffin he made for her. Choosing a coffin was on her bucket list. Calvin made Skye a promise to help her complete that list. I think Skye just knowing that Calvin had taken care of that item would have been enough without being too creepy.The movie was released direct to video in February.

reviews.review_title: Fantastic watch, not maudlin at all 🌟
reviews.content: This subject matter is not something I normally watch, but Asa Butterfield and Maisie Williams are both fantastic young actors. I absolutely loved this movie, it didn't dwell on the "big c", but reminds to live your life while you can.

reviews.review_title: A teen version of The Bucket List
reviews.content:
Then Came You is a romantic drama directed by Peter Hutchings, the director of Cool Girls and Rhymes with Banana.The film is about the teenager Calvin (Asa Butterfield). He works in the baggage department of an airport. He is suffering from hypochondria. He often thinks that he is wrongly sick or that something is wrong with him physically. This way he lives a quiet life and is otherwise very alone.
When he meets the terminally ill teenager Skye (Maisie Williams) she changes his life. Despite her illness, Skye is positive and tries to complete a Bucket List in her uncertain life. She calls her Bucket List to-die-list. In this way she encourages Calvin to help her with her list and suggests that he also tries to overcome his own fears. With each other's help, they take on their own fears and impossible challenges and actions.This film comes across as a teenage version of the movie The Bucket List, where two terminally ill men also make a Bucket List together and try to finish it completely before they die. The film also looks like a lesser version of The Fault in Our Stars, because they made that film in a more serious way.
Then Came You was unfortunately written by a novice script writer, which can mainly be seen by older viewers. Things happen in the film that may seem unrealistic to adult viewers. Agents who are friends with Calvin and Skye, for example, are stuck with people who may not even have done something wrong just to make their friends laugh. Comedy actor Ken Jeong himself plays one of the agents.
Many other different comedy moments also seem somewhat predictable and are therefore no longer funny for many. The many comedy moments in the film also flood the drama aspects, making them appear somewhat weak. The parents of Skye and Calvin do provide the best drama moments in the film, but because they are not very present in the film, these scenes also seem a bit too weak.The acting work is also known by the lesser script, the cast does not make much better of it. Asa Butterfield, Maisie Williams and Nina Dobrev are good actors and have already proven this with roles in other films and TV series. Asa Butterfield and Maisie Williams appear realistic as good friends trying to help each other with their problems. Unfortunately, due to the situations they are experiencing, it sometimes seems a bit too forced. The romantic relationships between Asa Butterfield and Nina Dobrev appear completely forced and then all the way through the twists that they make together in their relationship.

I could name at least five other movies whose plot isn't that different compared to this one. The only original thing about this film would be that it tries to be funny and optimistic and in contrast to other protagonists, Skye handles herself quite well despite her sickness. Unfortunately, that doesn't provide and interesting enough plot for this to be an original movie. The setting is also quite confusing. For the first half an hour or so I thought this was happening at Heathrow Airport but apparently not, as it is later revealed. Kids with cancer is such a cliché, even if it is a sad one. Just skip watching this, it's not worth it.

I'd love see Asa and Maisie acting in this movie, the heartwarm boy with a swag girl who is dying. And the relationship between Cal,Skyve, and Izzy is a roman ans funny at same time. Love the cast and actor performance

Really a nice story! we all really enjoyed the movie in many aspects ,first of all this a non stop comedy! if you ahave really a sence of humour you will obviously enjoy the move fro the start to end! i really seen this movie more than three times,because i really liked the story telling of this movie!

reviews.review_title: Watch this at home......with a box of tissues.
reviews.content:
Fabulously sadly sweet. Two amazing young actors with a great supporting cast.
Note: You might not want to download and watch this on your return flight from vacation. Crying on a plane can be quite undignified.....

Some things in life transcend words.A diamond of dreams shown in a glance.A kompendium of caring in an expression.
This film has got it all.The gentleness of its handling of brutal truths is a glowing tribute to the excellence of all the actors,without exception, of the direction,of the photography of the script.
This is not a film for cynics who are afreaid of feeling,especially feeling compassion.
It's not a 'feel good film', it's a 'feel better' film, the 'feel better' that happens when we start to truly understand ourselves.In that sense,it seems unworthy to criticise in any way, as such criticism becomes simply a reflection.Either be swept along by it's meaningful beauty, or switch off in the first 10 minutes
I'm 76, I've been around. This film is a beautiful essay about what really matters.

Just a bad movie with nothing enjoyable throughout.
I personally found it unwatchable and listening to the terrible American accents was unbearable.I managed to give the flick some points for the ending as it resembled something like a good movie, but the damage had been done.Judge for yourself, but I can't understand all the 10/10 reviews.

Started off with a lot of forced comedy but really transformed by the end and had me sobbing for the last like 30 minutes. It is a story that's been told over and over with the "brave terminally ill quirky kid" and the kid who is so scared of living that he is just existing, but I'm glad I watched all the way to the end... I would absolutely recommend you watch!

It started off very light and comedic, and then suddenly I was crying. I was upset that the two main characters didn't kiss or form a deeper connection than friends before she passed away because it felt like it was leading up to that and they were so cute when together, but at the same time I'm glad the movie strayed away from clichès and it made the ending even more sad thinking of what could have been if she hadn't been ill :(
Maisie and Asa played their parts perfectly and overall it's a movie I would definitely recommend!
I loved this movie. Storyline is good and has a very deep meaning. Another gem from Asa. I will Suggest you to watch this film ;)
It's a very interesting journey, the film ends in a blink of an eye, I loved every second of it, also it doesn't matter who you are the story will touch your hearth, I felt every emotions passed by.

I like movies like these, life, friendship and preferably feel good but in this case sad. I like the dude actor i've seen him in a few movies. The only thing I couldn't buy was he looks all of 15 years old (although in reality he's 21), and he hooks up with a stewardess who obviously looks 10 years older than him. Didn't really and ever fit.Anyway, really good movie and definitely worth the watch!
Great movie and touching end. I really liked skye, maisie williams ideally represented the role of skye . A beautiful friendship between skye and calvin,
It's a really cute movie about friendships, life and death. It's kind of a cliche, but an enjoyable one. Worth watching.

So yeah the story has been done before but this was a brilliantly light hearted version that has you laughing and crying. It really does make you connect to the characters and makes you feel all the emotions. Having gone through the cancer rollercoaster many times in my own life (big family) I feel it was a really well portrayed film that captures the ups and downs whilst keeping it light and allowing the viewer to laugh and smile even through the bleakest of subjects

After this movie, we feel really better! Thanks a lot!
Be HAPPY!

reviews.review_title: I'm going to keep this short and simple
reviews.content: This is the first movie in a long time that almost brought me to tears, and I'm the kind of guy who almost never cries, even when I want too.

reviews.review_title: Very deep and intersting values moovies
reviews.content: I really appreciate this moovie for its deep messages and the highly intersting values it raises.

A lovely rollercoaster from fun to sad emotions. The music was really good, the scenery beautiful and the acting spot on. Skye and Calvin stole my heart and made me cry for the first time in a long time.

I recently watched this movie as part of the Woodstock Film Festival and I was left amazed. The acting and chemistry between Maisie and Asa is so dynamic and I believe worthy of Oscar attention. I didn't know it was possible to feel so many emotions in such a short span but somehow this movie did just that. From crying one minute to laughing the next, there was not a dry eye in the theater. I definitely recommend everyone seeing this movie!

This movie has many things to relate to. The protagonist realises that life is enjoyable. It has difficulties that we need to overcome and sometimes... Sometimes life has losses, but it doesn't end there. We must keep moving forward and accept what life offers. The protagonist goes through all these emotions and proves that indeed life is too short to be sad.
Anyone reading this, smile. It will automatically make you happy. 😄😁

Calvin (Asa Butterfield) is a hypochondriac working with his father (David Koechner) and brother (Tyler Hoechlin) as an airport baggage handle after dropping out of college. He has a crush on flight attendant Izzy (Nina Dobrev). His doctor sends him to a cancer support group where he is befriended by irreverent dying girl Skye (Maisie Williams). She has a To Die List and he's too afraid to live.Maisie Williams is the Manic Pixie Dying Girl and Dobrev is the Less-Manic Pixie Dream Girl. The movie is doing too much and Maisie Williams is trying too hard. It throws all the dying girl tropes into this including former best friend, grieving parents, and hot guy lust. Then Asa Butterfield has his own set of issues. The saving grace is the loveable duo. They're lovely actors. It is odd to have two British actors acting as Americans although at least Maisie get to be British until she was ten. Even Dobrev is lovely here. Everybody is lovely except Ken Jeong who is, like the movie, trying too hard. The movie hits all the emotional beats on their heads. They would better off giving everything to Asa and Maisie and have them hang out by themselves. It's a simple Cyrano de Bergerac movie with cancer. It doesn't need all of the wacky cop, depressed mom, the dead sister, or former best friend. It's trying too hard.

Called Departures on some channels. A very poignant, in your face discussion of friendship and facing life on your own terms. Calvin (asa butterfield, from hugo!) is sure he has some life threatening disease. And then he meets skye (maisie williams) who actually DOES have a life threatening disease. She's determined to finish her list of things to do before she goes, and drags calvin along. Running gag where they keep getting pulled over by the same cops. Sense of humor about it all. But what's the alternative? It's very well done. Good editing, directing, and good performances by all. Directed by peter hutchings. Story by fergal rock. His first work to be turned into a full length film.

Some movies try tobe different and innovative but can go badly wrong. This is a refreshing film doesnt always hit the spot but in general restores your faith in movies. The two leads are excellent and complete the movie. A must see
Follows a similar formula like other movies,but kept my attention.

reviews.review_title: For Most People, It's Easier to Die Than It Is To Live
reviews.content: There are many people in the world who find it much more challenging to live than to die. As William Wallace famously says, "Every man dies, but not every man really lives."So many people toil and suffer, fearful of every day and what it might bring. Calvin is such a man. He lives out a mediocre and basically meaningless life working at the airport. He's also a hypochonriac who's convinced he has cancer or that he's always ill with some disease. He reminds me of Cameron from "Ferris Bueller's Day Off." He's happiest when he thinks he's sick. He doesn't have any real friends, and it's clear that he just tries to get through each day.Enter Skye, a vibrant young woman who embraces Life and what time she has left. She's terminally ill with cancer, and yet she refuses to let the illness stop her or deprive her of life's experiences. She meets Calvin at a cancer support group. For some reason, Calvin's doctor thought it would do him good to see what it's like for people who actually have the disease. Skye is a whirlwind of energy, and she soon captivates Calvin.In short, Skye uses the time she has left to teach Calvin how to live. To not be afraid. To embrace life's challenges and also to try his best to live his dreams.The relationship and chemistry between Asa Butterfield and Maisie Williams is perfect, and they counter each other very well. Butterfield's Calvin comes off as shy, quiet, and introverted. Willaims's Skye is loud, obnoxious, and extroverted. A perfect balance.As Calvin begins to learn how to live, he also begins to appreciate the gift that Skye has brought him. She doesn't even get angry that he's pretending to have cancer. Perhaps it's because she gets it. She understands, even she thinks it's silly.The only part of the movie that doesn't really work is with the character of Izzy. (Nina Dobrev). The chemistry between Dobrev and Butterfield just isn't there, and it made their romantic bond seem unrealistic. I wanted more of Calvin and Skye. Izzy would have made more sense at the end of the film. Perhaps Calvin finally decides to do something about it. But then, I'm sure Dobrev would never have accepted such a small role. Izzy simply doesn't work for the story as a whole. I'm also tired of seeing characters (for some reason, they tend to be mostly women) who stomp off angrily without demanding an explanation for deception. I don't know many people who would do that. It makes no sense. If someone you care about deceives you, you want to know why.Butterfield and Williams are clearly the strength of the movie. The film has some very humorous situations as well as moments that might tug at your heartstrings.Most people should take a note from this movie. Stop being afraid to live. Stop taking shelter in your comfort zone. As someone once said, "A comfort zone is a beautiful place, but nothing ever grows there." We don't know how much time we have. Make the most of it. Live as though you only have one day left.

Good grief man this movie is a mess of a mess. No mystery how this was going to play out from the start. Insultingly ludicrous scenarios punctuated with a few moments of levity and genuine tenderness. Absolutely boring soundtrack didn't help things. Superficial supporting characters only detracted from what power this film could have generated. Predictable eye rolling nonsense with the only eye candy being Nina Dobrey who is always irresistible no matter what. I don't even know why I gave this 3 stars....

reviews.review_title: I'm not sad too much, it doesn't reflect the feelings (7.5)
reviews.content:
Despite the comments it received and the points given by the critics, I liked the movie and it was very successful for me.I could not get the feeling of sadness, frankly, the movie did not upset me too much.
I don't think it reflects the story of a young girl who was sick(cancer), it was a fun and entertaining movie.

I expected something with substance. I love when actors move on from their huge television shows. Maisie was great in Doctor Who. She's great in this. Unfortunately, that's the only thing that's great.

reviews.review_title: An alright movie, but too cliche
reviews.content: I appreciate how the movie didn't put too much emphasis on the actual disease, but it was a bit too cartoonish and cliche for my liking. I think they could have focused a bit more on Calvin's mother and her healing/grieving process, and also Calvin's physical and emotional distress. Instead they loaded the movie with a slew of out of place characters (the police officers and flight attendants specifically). Also the slow motion scenes with music in the background got old after awhile.Nina Dobrev is eight years older than Asa Butterfield, so it's too much of a stretch to think they would have any spark. Butterfield is always typecast as an awkward character, too. I think he's a fine actor, but he doesn't have much room to shine here. Maisie Williams had a chance to show off here, she's cute and has tremendous energy.In terms of the actual storyline and character development for a 90 minute film, I can't complain. I didn't have any urge to turn it off. I would recommend it for younger adults and their families.
Had me in bits best film I have seen in years.The story is so touching and the acting is truly outstanding by both the lead actors. It's a must watch!

Death is fatal. And it's not frightening, if we really lived.
Work like you don't need the money, love like you've never been hurt, and dance like no one is watching." --- Satchel Paige
The lead boy is a young Andrew McCarthy. It was enjoyable enough to pass the time.

Go for this it's really very relatable...What we have and how lucky we are...
This movie is very silent but the emotion makes real nice.
It's very smoothening experience to watch this and the main 3 characters has nailed it.
Just simple and casual relations made the more perfect.
I can't see enough of the blue eyes that can talk. I also hope that the coffin when I die is made by someone who likes it.

This film has to have the most believable platonic portrayal of the lead actors. Calvin (Asa Butterfield) and Skye (Maisie Williams) have such good chemistry that makes you don't want them to be lovers all while managing to emotionally damage you at the end with a pretty decent ending.I still have to say that the film does rush over a few things, and I would've liked the makers to spend more time on developing other things which feel half-baked at best. They talk about Calvin's past related stuff but you don't really feel for him in particular until the very end where other characters' actions affect his life.Cinematography is decent, shots are nice and song choices are also fine but the major drawback of the film still remains that it doesn't try to go above and beyond.

Am I missing something? This movie was unwatchable and I almost turned it off a few times. Don't let the cast fool you as there are many well-known names. The script is horrible and the language these "teenagers" are using is so outdated. The characters are boring and simple. It wasn't hard to figure out how the movie was going to end just from the first minutes. I recommend you to not waste your time with this movie. I do like my fair share of bad movies but this one is not tolerable.

reviews.review_title: By the Numbers, but Enjoyable Nonetheless
reviews.content: The amount of cliches this movie had were too many to count. The awkward boy meets strange girl trope has been done to death at this point, not to mention the fact that one of them has cancer. Despite nearly every scene being done better before, I found the movie enjoyable and well acted.

The movie wasn't all too bad, but there were quite a few holes in it that kept me from being more invested in a story with such a serious subject. Not saying it wasn't enjoyable, but there were issues that could've been addressed (possibly even in editing) to leave me feeling more affected by the story and its characters rather than cheated out of my time.
Skye and Calvin meet in an interesting way, but soon there afterwards it's as though Skye has some sort of curiosity with Calvin, but it's never clarified as to what that is, what compels her to keep poking and prodding him, in wanting to be around him. If it was meant to be apparent to the audience without being vocal, it was lost.
Skye seems to be someone who has accepted her fate and tries to make the most out of every minute she has left, so why hang around some awkward, disinterested, slightly negative person who wants nothing to do with her? The answer: because... ....reasons...?
After Calvin suddenly accepts that Skye won't leave him be, they launch into a Bucket List montage where they are goofing around, laughing and smiling as though they've been friends for years. This is where is where it really started to fall apart for me because there was no build up to how they got to be this close to each other; from being slightly-less-distant strangers to best buds tackling each other on the lawn and laughing. There's no chemistry that lead us to understand this behaviour or how they got to suddenly be this close over ...hours? ...days (at best)? There's no timeline to even know. So why am I being led to think this should be believable?
Which brings me to my next point: no one knows how much time passes during this film. Maybe that was intentional in tying into the theme of Skye's terminal illness. We never know how much time we have so let's not inform the audience about how much time passes in the movie. Okay, sure, buuuuut.....
Ken Jeong plays officer Al who pops up a little here and there in the film. He cuts Skye and Calvin a lot of slack for the things they get caught doing all because he has seen them in the same cancer support group his father attends. While we know Skye has attended these meetings more than once, we also find out Calvin's doctor suggested he attend one meeting once in an effort to help out his hypochondria. We see this, but ONLY this one meeting. It's unclear if he continued to go to them because he soon gets caught in his unwillingness to come forward and correct people (like officer Al) that he doesn't have cancer. Furthermore, there's no insight as to why Calvin lies about this.
And Calvin's sudden dancing...? Please, don't even get me started on his dancing...
As the movie progresses, Calvin supposedly starts "coming out of his shell", but again, no insight as to why. Oh, it's because of Skye? Ok, how? What specifically is he getting from her that he hasn't been getting from anything else for the vast majority of his life? Where's the insight into that? Nowhere. It just happens and we're supposed to swallow it as it's force fed to us just like the montage that came before. You would think for a character that's finally finding himself in such a way (so quickly) that he would also be willing to man up and admit his false cancer, but no. Why? Again: reasons.
While the movie did start to feel like it held more of an impact near the last 1/3 of its life with Skye becoming more ill than ever, I feel it was too late for any audience member to become any more invested in this story and its characters. All those loose threads which had been swept under a rug and somehow supposed to have left us feeling emotionally involved and attached to these characters make for a bumpy and unsatisfying ending.
You never see too much aside from sadness and tears from any character on how they deal with Skye dying. You don't see the other emotions, no frustration, no anger, no sudden lashing out. Aside from one brief hallway scene in the hospital with Calvin and his brother where his brother says essentially "It's not about you it's about her..." Now man up, suppress any emotions you have and move on. Because cancer is only ever about those with cancer...? Never the ones that are affected around them...? Again, whatever message I'm supposed to get from this is lost, I'm just supposed to take it because of (say it with me now): reasons!
And then Skye dies. We don't see how it affects anyone, we don't see people mourning, we don't get even the slightest hint of what any of the characters we've met and watched for over the last hour are feeling or reacting. You see Skye alive one minute and then Calvin visiting her tombstone the next. So if anyone in the audience did somehow manage to get attached to these two main characters up to now, guess what? You get no resolution, no closure, no follow through to what they'd been leading up to because REASONS!
Oh, and for some reason there is a love interest for Calvin which doesn't pan out or lead to anything interesting - AND - Calvin has a mother who "shut down" after Calvin's twin sister died when he was 8 .... and I guess she's still around after the movie ends, unaffected. Not sure what her relevance in the movie was really about when you see her on screen for MAYBE a whole minute throughout the films entirety and no social interaction from anyone else in the film. I feel like this was a wasted opportunity to take a broken character in Calvin's life and bring them to light, comparing their mental illness to Skye's in such a dark time. But hey, you know.....
I usually enjoy films with Asa Butterfield and I've enjoyed watching Maisie Williams on Game of Thrones so I figured from the preview of this film and its subject matter that this would have been a great film to watch. In the end I feel like there was some sloppy directing, poor writing, and bad editing (but not so much as no amount of editing could be done to fill the holes in this cheesecloth of a film).
Thanks to Ken Jeong and Tituss Burgess for adding a bit of comedic flare here and there in the movie, otherwise I'd give this film probably a 3/10.

Can't say anything
It was really nice and fun and sad movie
I suggest to teens

First, I loved the cast and it couldn't be any better. Asa as confused but thoughtful and Maisie being as cheerful to punch him in the face (oh god! this was epic). To add further their wonderful chemistry is a whole lot enough to fall for.I have many reasons to love this piece with on top was honesty it hits on people spending life in a mess waiting for it to start while they don't have to. Begins as a cliche genre, but soon teaches you life lessons - truly platonic friendship was a gem.Even if it's not your type it will prove to be a sweet and pleasant surprise.

The two characters back up and complimented each other very well in this movie.Both are great actors also the side too did an amazing job.Such a rollercoaster of emotions.I personally enjoyed it.Asa as also nailed his character even Maisie.Whats with Masie wanting to have sex before her death same thing was happening to her in GOT too LoL.Joke aside,I really loved this movie.Well Done.

Asa Butterfield and Maisie Williams deliver great performances, with superb chemistry and a poetic touch. The scenario isn't new by any means, but this is a fresh take on it, and the film positively thrums along on an upbeat note.Made me emotional in some scenes, so deserves credit for being emotionally engaging. The soundtracks are quite well chosen and put together, and are heavily used to build the 'atmosphere' of key scenes.Definitely a must watch if you're a fan of Asa or Maisie!

reviews.review_title: Short, sweet, all too close to home.
reviews.content:
Non-spoilers:
A hypochondriac and a person with late stage cancer become friends and it's legitimately one of the most touching films put on screen.Spoilers:
The way this film ripped my heart out at the end and still had me smiling with dried tear tracks down my face is an indicator that the film is good.
Maisie filmed this between seasons of Game of Thrones, and it really helps shed the restrictive roles she'd been limited to.
If you haven't seen it but don't care about spoilers:
Something I feel it's often overlooked in sorties about death are the lingering impacts. What hurts the most in real life about a friend dying is the persisting knowledge that they are gone, the rest of your life where that person is absent.
A lot of films that came out close together were about young pairs that both happened to have life threatening cancer and one or both of said party would be gone by the end of the story.
This movie nails a mix where the leads are both compatible but never pursue a romantic relationship, and one lead is clearly marked for death while the other has to live after she's gone.
Calvin isn't without his own trauma, and it gets explored in the movie, Skye has some personal difficulties with relationships, and the pair make excellent friends.
Which means you're going to carry that weight.Excellent movie, 10/10.
I couldn't get threw this movie. These two characters are not at all likable. The plot is boring and the two main characters is extremely obnoxious.

Amazing work by lead cast.I had no plans of watching this film, just watched it by chance. I didn't see the trailer, didn't bother seeing reviews, and frankly it doesn't even matter now. The way actors have portrayed the characters, it was like a cool breeze on a hot summer day.Sometimes you wait for a film to release, and find it annoying.Then you come across certain work that you didn't knew existed.Refreshing and different.For some reason, I like this and not 'The fault in our stars'.Is it normal ?
